page.title: 05THE COALMAN - GILLING WEST
page.content:
My dad is the{village coalman.}He gets his coal supply from{Mr.J.B. Watson who lives in{Stockton.}My dad has a piece of land up{Waters Lane}where he stores his coal.He started in{1979.
My dad sells open sacks of 50kg.A tonne is 20 bags of coal.He has two Bedford Wagons. One can hold 10 tonnes the other holds 15 tonnes .He sells sunbrite ,anthracite, house coal, coalite,best phurnacite,and homefire. Best consists of the largest lumps of coal, anthracite beans are very small.
Although the business is based in Gilling my dad travels to surrounding villages and towns such as{Richmond, and{Barnard Castle}to sell his coal. He sells about 12 tonnes on a winter day and about 4 tonnes on a summer day.
